physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient was alert but bewildered and fearful, oriented to self only. Limited insight into her situation. Inattentive, distractible, unable to articulate concerns coherently. Activity varied from severe psychomotor retardation to agitation. Followed two-step commands but unable to perform more complex tasks. Pupils symmetric, 3 mm in diameter, briskly reactive to light. Deep-tendon reflexes were diffusely brisk. Plantar responses were extensor bilaterally.
Funduscopic examination revealed bilateral optic-disk swelling. Neurologic examination normal except as detailed.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Optic-disk swelling resolved one month later, headaches improved further.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Opening pressure of 20 cm of water during lumbar puncture.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Results of CSF analysis indicated lymphocytic pleocytosis. MRI findings showed extensive diffuse signal abnormalities within the white matter.
